Package rendering.filledBox

Class FilledBoxRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • rendering.filledBox.FilledBoxRenderer
  • public class FilledBoxRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
    Controls rendering filled boxes, such as those which appear behind text buttons, behind text in text boxes, or the header. As far as rendering is concerned a filled box consists of a position, a size, and a color. The position and size are two dimensional vectors in the OpenGL coordinate system while the color is a three dimensional rgb color vector.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FilledBoxRenderer

        public FilledBoxRenderer()
        Initializes for text box rendering. Creates the shader program, loads the model to the GPU, and initializes the default transforms.

    • Method Detail

      • renderToScreen

        public void renderToScreen​(FlowchartWindowController flowchartWindowController,
                           CodeWindowController codeWindowController)
        Renders all GUIFilledBox filled boxes to the screen which are not part of the GUI. Filled boxes are any rectangular region with a solid background color. The exception is the background of the flowchart which is instead the OpenGL clear color which the screen is set to before rendering each frame.
        Parameters:
        flowchartWindowController - the controller which contains all flowchart filled boxes
        codeWindowController - the controller which contains the filled boxes for the code window

      • renderToImage

        public void renderToImage​(FlowchartWindowController flowchartWindowController)
        Renders all filled boxes to an image which are part of the flowchart. Filled boxes are any rectangular region with a solid background color. The exception is the background of the flowchart which is instead the OpenGL clear color which the screen is set to before rendering each image.
        Parameters:
        flowchartWindowController - the controller which contains all flowchart filled boxes

      • renderGuis

        public void renderGuis​(Header header)
        Renders all filled boxes which are part of the gui. This is a separate call from #renderToImage because gui filled boxes may render over the flowchart such as in an text button and this involves rendering over text and flowchart lines this call must happen after those have been rendered.
        Parameters:
        header - the header currently used which contains a filled box as it's background TODO: Switch out Header for a GUI Controller

      • renderGUIElements

        public void renderGUIElements​(java.util.List<GUIElement> elementList)
        Renders all gui elements contained in a gui window.
        Parameters:
        elementList - the list of elements which may contain a filled box to render

      • renderFilledBox

        private void renderFilledBox​(GUIFilledBox filledBox)
        Renders a single filled box. Loads the color, a calculated transformation matrix to put the filled box in the right location with the right scale, and renders the box.
        Parameters:
        filledBox - the filled box to be rendered. Contains a three dimensional vector representing an RBG color, and two dimensional vectors representing the position and size in the OpenGL coordinate system.

      • cleanUp

        public void cleanUp()
        Cleans up the memory of the filled box shader. The filled box shader has a GPU program used to render saved inside of GRAM. This will not be automatically cleaned up by the Java garbage collector so it must be deleted manually when this renderer will no longer be used. Called automatically when the program is closed.

      • prepare

        private void prepare()
        Sets the OpenGL state to be appropriate for rendering lines of formatted text and binds the filled box model for rendering.

      • endRendering

        private void endRendering()
        Unbinds the filled box model and restores the OpenGL state for another renderer to be called.
